From: William Hendrix-Sicard <William.Hendrix-Sicard@piicomm.ca>
Sent: June 18, 2025 10:57 AM
To: Mandip Grewal <mandip.grewal@piicomm.ca>; Phil Alexandre <phil.alexandre@piicomm.ca>; Lee-Anne McRae <LeeAnne.McRae@piicomm.ca>; Shawn Winter <Shawn.Winter@piicomm.ca>
Cc: Rick Robillard <Rick.Robillard@piicomm.ca>; Adam Nicol <adam.nicol@piicomm.ca>
Subject: RE: Reimagined (Imperial) Parking - Subscriber List

 

Hi Mandip,

It will be PS hours for sure as the billing, the question here is how many.
We have not done this for Jira from what I understand. So, this would be a new build.

The problem is we don’t know how robust the connection to Jira needs to be made for re-imagined right now.

We need to understand some of the following but not limited too:

  • What trigger events are we supporting
  • What fields need to be synced
  • Are there custom fields that we should be aware of?
  • Do we need real time syncing *SLA and Audit requirements*
  • What is the expected ticket volume *Roughly*
  • Will Attachments, comments, or status need to be mirrored? 
  • What are the escalation workflows

 

After our short call, this morning it sounds like the tickets can come from Jira but also from the portal which will require us to do things like sync tickets back to Jira once they have been answered and actioned by the help desk on STRATIX side.

 

Ultimately the connection should be like the below, but we will need to know what details will be passed:

End User – Reimagined

   │

   ▼

[Jira (Initial Intake)] - Reimagined

   │

   ▼

[Stratix (Triage / OEM Dispatch)] - Stratix

   │

   ▼

[ServiceNow and/or AIM Portal (Partner Systems)] – PiiComm

   │

   ▼

[Fix / Resolution Performed] - PiiComm

   │

   ▼

[Jira ↔ ServiceNow / Stratix (Status + Resolution Sync)] – Reimagined/Stratix

   │

   ▼

End User (Notified of Closure / Resolution) – Reimagined

  1. End User submits issue → captured in Jira.
  2. Jira routes or escalates to Stratix (e.g., for repair triage or OEM forwarding).
  3. Stratix hands off to ServiceNow or AIM Portal (depending on partner or service model).
  4. Issue is resolved by appropriate party.
  5. Fix/Resolution data flows back into Jira and Stratix, *possibly* syncing with ServiceNow.
  6. End user is notified of resolution via Jira or your support front end.


I think considering the touchpoints I would be more aligned to look at 3 days of charged work for the *baseline* and any additions or changes to the model would need to be charged PS work.

@Phil Alexandre
Can you provide me with an export of the fields we currently support for connection with Service now? (A payload is fine)
Ticket ID, Device ID, Name, Location, ect? (This can be our Baseline)

@Shawn Winter Do you still feel comfortable with 3 days of charged work as a baseline?

@Mandip Grewal
Here is breakdown of what I see for PS hours as of today.

  • Jira Integration (5days) Baseline (Creation of tickets, few statuses and workflow for LCM, ect)
  • Laptop MDMaaS – GI/Takeover (3days) Baseline (We assume the workload of what they have and work with them to improve it)
  • Mass360 to 42Gears (5 days) This can be removed from the PS hours if you can provide in writing that 42 gears will do the migration for scripts and profiles, we are good to remove this; *HOWEVER*, If 42 gears are charging us to do the work, we will need to include PS hours. (Can adjust if they are charging us)
  • Apple Devices ABM to 42 Gears (1 day)

 

No 42 gears support PS: 112 Hours

42 Gears support PS: 72 hours

  • Additional PS: Onboarding (1-2day)

 

Total 80-88 or 120-128 hours depending on 42gears and Shawn.W.

Let me know if anyone has any current questions, concerns, or comments.

Warm regards,
William

Hey Mandip.

 

Just a follow-up about this Jira request…We would be able to offer them a REST API and the appropriate documentation for it in a Swagger format with about 3 days of effort to build, test and publish it.  The client would need someone at their end to configure their Jira services to talk to the API and configure the feeds.  We would issue the client a unique set of credentials that is private to them along with a secret API Key that they’ll need to connect.

 

The API would offer them the ability to send us an electronic request through JIRA using the API, we could offer them status fields, notes about the ticket, etc. that they could access by calling our database through the API.

 

With other activities currently underway, there is lead time of approximately 2 weeks before starting and roughly 3 days of development work.  I hope that helps.

On Wed, May 7, 2025 at 1:23 PM Mandip Grewal <mandip.grewal@piicomm.ca> wrote:

Hi Casey,

 

T2 Systems

  • These parking stations run on IRIS and come with their own management system that they should have access to. It is supposed to give them information on revenue per location, dashboards of online/offline, remote support. Who is managing this internally?
  • TEM – IoT sims will be unlimited (not sure it makes sense to add these to TEM) – the only use case I see is to track active or de-active sims but we can work with your WSS team on that reporting monthly as part of the LCM scope to save them costs

 

TEM pricing

  • I will have pricing for you to inject into your proposal tomorrow it will come from me not Cheryl (this will be customer facing for the Wireless subscribers. For wireline we need more information as cost is based on invoices/spend, # of carriers, etc

 

MDM Scope

  • For MDM-MAS-TELUS scope this is the management and licenses. You can use:
    • Mobile Device Management as a Service (MDMaaS) provides customers with a complete solution, including MDM software licensing, system hosting, and management services. Our Mobile Device Management (MDM) service offers comprehensive management of either a new or existing MDM software solution by certified technicians located in-country. Our services encompass security administration, MDM and device configuration, user administration, and reporting tailored to meet the specific needs of our customers.

MOTUS

  • We need to understand what this $1.75/device includes is it MDM, lifecycle management, etc
  • What MDM are they using? Do they want to continue to use that MDM and we take over the management
  • We can certainly support North America and will highlight it

 

Tangoe/Jira

  • Tangoe is a TEM as well. There is a lot they do so we need to understand what they are using this for
  • JIRA if they want continue using this ticketing system we can certainly look at integrating and creating a workflow that sends tickets to our ITSM or we can allow them use our portal as a part of the LCM SKU at no additional cost.
  • For SLA/SLO I can share examples of our reporting – we do monthly governance reporting and tracking of open tickets – the customer will also have access to this and see where their tickets are in real time in our portal

 

Let me know if I missed anything.

There will be more discovery on this call but I still feel Andrea doesn’t have all the information as well but we will get there!

Hi Mandip,

 

Following up on our conversation from Monday, I wanted to touch base on a few key items before our meeting with Andrea and Elvia this Friday.

 

As a reminder she confirmed they use T2 Parking meters (she will be exporting info on these SIMs for TELUS to price out as soon as I know what details are needed from our team to do so). From the dashboard it looked like there were just under 1,400 SIMs in use for these meters.

 

Could you please provide an update on whether we anticipate having the TEM pricing available by Friday? Is there anything from my end I can push with Cheryl to help here?

 

Also, I wanted to circle back on the scope language for MDM Management versus MDMaaS Managed and Hosted. The attached Quote from Partner Hub currently uses the same description for both. Do we have updated language to differentiate these offerings?

 

Regarding their global needs, can we outline how our solution can support both their US and Canadian operations? While they currently spend approximately $1.75 CDN per device to Motus, they are not satisfied with their current support. We should emphasize our differentiators and the value we bring in this area.

 

Were you able to look into their current systems, Tango (for laptops and printers) and Jira (for cells and tablets)? They are aiming to streamline these processes. We should be prepared to discuss how a unified system can lead to cost reduction and improved efficiency.

 

Key pain points they've mentioned include:

  • An overwhelming volume of requests via email, making it difficult for their IT help desk to centralize. They are interested in a potential API for streamlined ticketing.
  • Lack of visibility into SLA/SLO for individual tickets due to their current system.

For your reference, I've attached the proposal I presented and the Quote from Partner Hub. I'm happy to make adjustments as needed for our meeting.

 

Just as a reminder, the first hour of our meeting on Friday (2-3 pm) will focus on our WLS and the PiiComm proposals, and we will then move into a WLN discussion. I will also add these details to the calendar invitation.

 

Thank you for your continued collaboration on this opportunity. I'm looking forward to our discussion.

 

Thanks,

Here is a copy of the latest agenda. 

SPEAKER REGISTRATION & ARRIVAL TIME
As a presenter, you have been automatically registered for the full day. Click here to review and update your registration.
 
Upon arrival, please proceed to the event registration desk to collect your name badge. We recommend arriving at least one hour before your session. Our team will be available to address any last-minute questions or concerns.
 
PRESENTER REQUIREMENT FORM 
To assist with our preparations, click the link to complete the speaker requirement form, no later than Friday May 30, 2025. There are questions pertaining to your attendance at the event, your audio-visual requirements and a list of terms and conditions to review prior to your participation. Please note, this form is required for participation.  

PRESENTATION DUE DATE (For keynote speakers/chairs only)
Your slide deck is due for submission on Tuesday, June 10, 2025. Please note the following PowerPoint specifications and recommendations:
  • If you have video(s) embedded, please send the file separately and advise which slide number it needs to be embedded. Do not embed audio or video clips within the presentation
  • Limit the animations and do not use timed animations
  • Do not use read-only fonts
  • Avoid using fading or transitional backgrounds
  • If the file is too large to send, please let us know and we will provide an alternative solution.
 
**When sending in your presentation, please confirm that you consent to having a pdf version of your presentation posted online for our members
 
PANEL SESSION INTRODUCTION EMAIL (for panel session members)
Our event producer, Kamia Sharma,  will be sending out the introduction email for your panel session soon. This will include all proposed questions and will allow all panelists and session moderator for some discussion on general questions that can be used to kick-start the discussion on the day.
 
UPCOMING IMPORTANT DATES

June 6, 2025 – PSN will send additional logistic information pertaining to your participation

Cc: Rohit Nair <Rohit.Nair@ipsos.com>; Shawn Winter <Shawn.Winter@piicomm.ca>; Julie Harrison <julie.harrison@piicomm.ca>; Devina Rayonia <Devina.Rayonia@ipsos.com>
Subject: RE: Survey results

 

Hi Shawn,

 

As promised, sharing the findings of the EMMS research.

 

Key Finding:

  • EMMS space presents a significant opportunity – decision makers anticipate increased reliance on third party vendors and expect their spending in this area to increase in future.
  • Pricing is a key driver for acquisition, as it is the main reason for choosing a vendor led solution. It is also a major factor in vendor switching.
  • Device, Data, Mobile application management related features are ‘Must have’ features; while User friendly interface, integration with existing systems, 24X7 support, multi-platform capabilities, secure access and Malware protection are the key differentiators that can be leveraged as key conversion hooks.
  • Both solution concepts (Telecom Carrier-led solution and DaaS solution) performed well and generated strong interest among decision makers.

 

Please let us know if you have any questions.

 

Regards,

Amit

Subject: RE: Mandip / Franz - RBC - 40k units

 

Great insight, thanks for sharing.  With any luck, the relationships that Rick has forged with Samsung here in Canada will go a long way in possibly partnering on this opportunity, and others.  They may have the software tools in place through 3rd parties like Brightfin, but I would be shocked if they have the human-ware and a support “factory” like we do to execute.

Hi Rick,

 

I hope the weeks going well. I didn’t want to be a pest and figured you have plenty on your plate. Can you let me know if you’re eyeing a day to catch up with us next week?

 

We know this has to make financial sense for PiiComm so we’ll do our best to remove any barriers to us doing business together. We truly want to make the partnership successful. Just let me know what you’re thinking and whether there’s still unanswered questions about anything we’ve covered.

 

Thanks,

Victor

 

Victor Hollo  

Director of Sales

<image001.png>

 

 

(414)-436-3804

vhollo@valicomcorp.com

 

From: Victor Hollo
Sent: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 9:16 AM
To: Rick Robillard <Rick.Robillard@piicomm.ca>
Subject: PiiComm & Valicom Partnership Info

 

Good morning Rick,

 

We talked yesterday and I wanted to get you our feedback.

 

On the scope of work itself, we’re good with the plan. One question is on the cadence or monthly flow of info to Valicom. Is there a reason we’d only be receiving the data at the end of the month on a single day? Or, could we agree on our standard workflow where our team is ingesting data throughout the month and loading it as it comes in? We weren’t sure if there was a labor/resource concern there, but that would be our preference as it helps with resources on our end and then prevents the need for a mad dash at the end of the month. In order to point out anomalies we’d want there to be enough lag time after we process each batch of data, and 1-3 days may be tough to load everything in, analyze and validate it. Spreading it out on a rolling basis would basically make it a non-issue.

 

Will there be any custom report requests from this client or from PiiComm to better serve the client? And if so, could we get a sense or the exact specs of what that reporting would be? That way we can get that request in with our IT team early and keep things moving.

 

For the pricing for this first client, we’d offer a 20% discount off the latest price list since we really want to prove ourselves and make it as easy as possible to get started with minimal risk. So instead of $1,414/mo. it’s $1,131/mo CAD. We can also commit that we’d hold the price list in place for 36 months for this first client. What that means to us is we’d use the latest price list to calculate their fees (and apply the 20% discount) and as time goes on we’d still be trueing up their device count quarterly and reassessing fees based on whatever tier of devices they fall into. If you need more assurances on this point just let me know so I can make sure we nail that for you.

 

You had also asked about hosting data for certain clients in Canada specifically. I checked into this, and at a base level I think it’s certainly possible. 11:11 Systems has a data center outside Toronto, and through a migration effort we could likely explore what it would take to satisfy this requirement for a given client or set of them. Obviously, the opportunities would need to be large enough to drive that initiative, and when the time’s right I’d pull Mike in to lead that discussion from our end so he can coordinate with IT.

 

Let me know if you have questions, and feel free to reply or I’m good to talk anytime soon.  

 

Victor

 

Victor Hollo  

Director of Sales

From: Victor Hollo <vhollo@valicomcorp.com>
Sent: March 24, 2025 12:41 PM
To: Rick Robillard <Rick.Robillard@piicomm.ca>; Mandip Grewal <mandip.grewal@piicomm.ca>
Cc: Mike Krogman <mkrogman@valicomcorp.com>
Subject: RE: Opportunity (PiiComm & Valicom)

 

Good morning guys,

 

Mandip, I got your other email as well. We agree, let’s meet and work towards ironing out those details like the exchange rate, getting started w/ a 1st client to prove out our effort, etc. We’re confident once you get the feel of working with our team and have us open up that visibility that you’re going to love the service as it will complement the work you already do well.

 

Does 3pm CDT tomorrow or 1pm/2pm CDT Thursday work for you both? This week is tough but let us know if there’s a better window and we’ll move things out of the way. Joining me on our call will be General Manager, Mike Krogman and he’ll help fill in the blanks for us.

 

I shared with Mike that PiiComm operates on a sell-through model and supports multiple carriers like Telus today. Most of all, you want contract management capabilities, better inventory management that links devices to users, integration w/ HRIS systems and the solution being cloud-based. We also covered the history of you using a patchwork of different TEM solutions and how you’d really like to standardize on a white-labeled solution for all PiiComm clients. When we meet let’s also sync up on that specific opp you mentioned (the client using Mobis)…I know Wireline is coming up more and more, and I’m certain we can assist there.

 

Thanks,

Victor

 

Victor Hollo 

Director of Sales

Valicom

(414)-436-3804

vhollo@valicomcorp.com

www.valicomcorp.com

 

From: Rick Robillard <Rick.Robillard@piicomm.ca>
Sent: Monday, March 24, 2025 7:50 AM
To: Victor Hollo <vhollo@valicomcorp.com>; Mandip Grewal <mandip.grewal@piicomm.ca>
Subject: RE: Opportunity

 

Thank you, Victor,

 

We should have a follow up meeting to put plans/meeting and schedules in place.

 

As for the pricing in CDN, will this change monthly, or will a client be locked in at the set exchange rate of when the deal closes? The longer we can hold a rate, the better as we do not have the luxury to change pricing monthly with a lot of our clients.

 

Rick

Subject: RE: Opportunity

 

Good afternoon guys,

 

I have the new CAD-based price model attached for your review. The conversion rate we used is 1.43 CAD to 1 USD which is today’s conversion rate.

 

When we talk next, I’d like to address clauses for both:

  • A “true-up” period (quarterly/biannually) on device count for each client (when the environment is wireless only)
  • A window of time (every 12 months?) where we can review the conversion rate and make agreed-upon changes as necessary.

 

And I also want to see if you had questions on the partner agreement. I’ve brought my GM Mike up to speed on the latest, and I’d want to include him on our next call. Can you suggest a few times for this week or early next week when it works for both of you? Glad to answer anything in the meantime.

Victor

From: Mandip Grewal <mandip.grewal@piicomm.ca>
Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2025 9:56 AM
To: Victor Hollo <vhollo@valicomcorp.com>
Cc: Rick Robillard <Rick.Robillard@piicomm.ca>
Subject: Opportunity

 

Victor,

 

Can your platform support this?

 

 

We have a client with MS Teams Direct Routing at multiple sites. Unfortunately, they cannot see their billing by site and instead have one bill from TELUS that is aggregate of all users across their sites. I believe the limitation is with the MS portal for MS Teams.  Do you offer an easy and affordable service to ingest the customer's CDR from MS Teams and break out their billing by groups of DIDs such as 8 DIDs at Oshawa site and 10 DIDs at London site, etc...? We would want the standard charges plus any additional charges like LD to be identified by site.  The goal is to understand what each customer site is billing as part of the MS Teams offering so it's not one big bill they have to interpret.

 

So.... here's my translation.  I assume this is something like what a TEM can do.  This is a known problem for many Teams customers.  I assume (this needs to be clarified) the client will pay the bill directly to Microsoft in full but is then looking for a way to break out the expenses internally by office or department or whatever.

 

 

Mandip Grewal

416.881.8640

title: [PiiComm Inc.] AWS Access
description:
Approval for costs incurred

Backup Schedules?

Tenable and ESET scanning?

Patching?

 

Requirements:

To expand on your request, here’s the complete breakdown of requirements and detailed configuration needed for your EC2 instance, including Git for CI/CD through GitHub Actions, Node.js for application runtime, PM2 for process management, and configuration for outbound connections to external services like Azure OpenAI and Azure Entra. We'll also cover Server-Sent Events (SSE) configuration for real-time communication.

Instance Requirements

  1. Git (for Source Code Management and CI/CD via GitHub Actions)
    • Git will be needed to clone your repository and manage version control.
  2. Node.js (to run the application)
    • Node.js (v16 or higher) is required to run your Nuxt 3 application.
  3. PM2 (for Process Management)
    • PM2 is a production-grade process manager for Node.js apps that ensures your application stays alive and automatically restarts if it crashes.
  4. Outbound Connections to Azure Services (like OpenAI and Azure Entra)
    • Configuration of your instance will need to allow outbound connections to Azure services (e.g., Azure OpenAI API, Azure Entra) to ensure that your app can call these external APIs.
  5. Server-Sent Events (SSE) for Real-time Communication
    • SSE is used for pushing real-time updates from the server to the client, and the server may need to be configured to maintain persistent connections.

Detailed Setup for the EC2 Instance

1. Launch the EC2 Instance:

  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04 or Amazon Linux 2 (ensure the chosen OS version is compatible with the software stack).
  • Instance type: t3.medium or a more powerful instance depending on traffic.
  • Security group: Open ports 22 (SSH), 80 (HTTP), 443 (HTTPS), and any custom ports required for the application (e.g., 3000 for Nuxt app).

2. Install Git:

  • Git is essential for source code management and continuous integration.

sudo apt update

sudo apt install git

3. Install Node.js:

  • We will use Node.js v16+, the latest stable version recommended for Nuxt 3.

curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_16.x | sudo -E bash -

sudo apt install -y nodejs

  • Verify installation:

node -v

npm -v

4. Install PM2 for Process Management:

  • PM2 helps manage your Nuxt application and ensures it remains running even after server restarts or crashes.

sudo npm install -g pm2

  • Check PM2 version:

pm2 -v

5. Outbound Connections to Azure Services (Azure OpenAI & Azure Entra):

  • Azure OpenAI: To access the OpenAI API via Azure, you will need to configure the instance to communicate with external services securely.
    • Firewall configuration: Ensure your EC2 instance allows outbound requests to Azure’s IP ranges (e.g., OpenAI or Entra).
    • Set up environment variables for API keys securely: Create a .env file in the root of your Nuxt project with the required credentials for Azure services:
    • AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY=your_azure_openai_api_key
    • AZURE_ENTRA_API_KEY=your_azure_entra_api_key
    • Network Access: If Azure services require a specific network configuration (e.g., specific outbound IPs or VNET), ensure your EC2 instance is configured to comply with these requirements. You may also need to configure VPC peering or PrivateLink for Azure if required.

6. Configure Server-Sent Events (SSE) for Real-Time Communication:

  • Server-Sent Events (SSE) allows the server to send automatic updates to the browser. For this to work seamlessly, you need to configure your server for long-lived HTTP connections.
  • Install necessary dependencies (if using Nuxt API routes):
  • npm install express
  • In your server configuration, ensure persistent HTTP connections are handled. This is often handled automatically by Nuxt, but if needed, you can explicitly set up SSE routes in a custom server.

Example of creating an SSE endpoint in Nuxt 3 API routes (server/api/sse.js):

export default defineEventHandler(async (event) => {

  const res = event.node.res;

 

  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'text/event-stream');

  res.setHeader('Cache-Control', 'no-cache');

  res.setHeader('Connection', 'keep-alive');

  res.flushHeaders();

 

  // Function to send a message every 10 seconds (for testing)

  setInterval(() => {

    res.write('data: Hello from the server!\n\n');

  }, 10000);

 

  // Close connection if client disconnects

  req.on('close', () => {

    console.log('Client disconnected');

  });

});

  • Configure the EC2 instance to support SSE: Ensure your EC2 instance and any reverse proxy (e.g., Nginx) allow persistent HTTP connections and don't time out.

Nginx configuration example:

server {

    listen 80;

    server_name _;

 

    location /api/sse {

        proxy_pass http://localhost:3000/api/sse;

        proxy_http_version 1.1;

        proxy_set_header Connection "keep-alive";

        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;

        proxy_set_header Host $host;

        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;

    }

 

    location / {

        proxy_pass http://localhost:3000;

        proxy_http_version 1.1;

        proxy_set_header Connection "keep-alive";

    }

}

7. Set Up CI/CD with GitHub Actions:

  • GitHub Actions is used for automating builds and deployments.
  • You need a GitHub repository for your Nuxt 3 application.
  • Create a workflow file in .github/workflows/deploy.yml:
  • name: Deploy Nuxt 3 App to EC2
  •  
  • on:
  •   push:
  •     branches:
  •       - main
  •  
  • jobs:
  •   deploy:
  •     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  •  
  •     steps:
  •     - name: Checkout code
  •       uses: actions/checkout@v2
  •  
  •     - name: Set up Node.js
  •       uses: actions/setup-node@v2
  •       with:
  •         node-version: '16'
  •  
  •     - name: Install dependencies
  •       run: |
  •         npm install
  •  
  •     - name: Build and deploy
  •       run: |
  •         npm run build
  •         pm2 reload all --update-env
  •       env:
  •         PM2_HOME: /home/ubuntu/.pm2
  •         PM2_PROCESS_FILE: /path/to/your/app

 

- This workflow installs dependencies, builds the app, and deploys it using PM2 on your EC2 instance whenever changes are pushed to the `main` branch.

 

#### 8. **Start the Application with PM2**:

- **Start the Nuxt app** using PM2 for process management:

```bash

pm2 start npm --name "nuxt-chatbot" -- run start

  • To ensure that PM2 starts automatically on reboot:

pm2 startup

pm2 save

9. Final Configuration (Optional):

  • SSL with Let's Encrypt: If you want to use HTTPS, configure SSL certificates using Let's Encrypt.
  • Security: Ensure proper security group settings on AWS, especially for outbound connections to external APIs.

Summary of EC2 Instance Configuration:

  • Git: Installed for source code management and CI/CD.
  • Node.js: Installed to run the Nuxt 3 application.
  • PM2: Installed to manage the application process.
  • Outbound Connections: EC2 instance allows outbound access to Azure OpenAI and Azure Entra.
  • SSE Configuration: SSE configured for real-time communication.
  • CI/CD with GitHub Actions: Automated deployment to EC2 using GitHub Actions and PM2.

This setup will allow you to host a robust Nuxt 3 AI chatbot on your EC2 instance, with process management, CI/CD, and real-time communication enabled. Let me know if you need further adjustments or help with any part of the setup!
